intro: Pimpinella wallichii, commonly known as the Himalayan cowparsley, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine habitats, thriving in cool, moist environments. Its seeds are small and oval, often dispersed by wind, contributing to its distribution across high-altitude regions. Pimpinella wallichii is also valued for its ornamental appeal and traditional medicinal uses in local cultures.
